greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of permutations of 3 indistinguishable copies of 1..n with exactly 4 adjacent element pairs in decreasing order.
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..200
formula: a(n) = 35^n - (3*n + 1)*20^n + binomial(3*n+1, 2)*10^n - binomial(3*n+1, 3)*4^n + binomial(3*n+1, 4). - _Andrew Howroyd_, May 07 2020
program: (PARI) a(n) = {35^n - (3*n + 1)*20^n + binomial(3*n+1, 2)*10^n - binomial(3*n+1, 3)*4^n + binomial(3*n+1, 4)} \\ _Andrew Howroyd_, May 07 2020
results.author: _R. H. Hardin_, May 29 2009
ext: Terms a(9) and beyond from _Andrew Howroyd_, May 07 2020
